Description: Jellabia or tunic; fragment of; Large fragment of undyed (unbleached) linen with vertical stripes of bright blue silk (a repeating group of three paired stripes) and black silk (paired stripes to either side of blue stripes, a separate group of three stripes and triple pin stripes between the blue stripes) with white silk filling the spaces between these. Two seams: one vertical, one at a slight angle, hem along the bottom and returning up from a corner. Warp: linen, Z-spun, ca 28 threads/cm, silk, Z-twist, ca 36 paired silk threads/cm. Weft: linen, Z-spun, ca 15 picks/cm. Edges: hidden or fragmentary. Sewing: hemming and sewing (run and fell) in Z-twist S-ply white silk sewing thread.
Curator's comments: History of use; certainly part of a garment, the hem being the lower edge. A seam with one vertical piece of cloth joining another at a slight angle, as in one of the seam here, is typical of the side joins of jellabia type long shirts and related coats.
Condition: Very fragmentary; black silk especially rotten.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
